messages.message: When you click on the link to a page in multi-step reasoning (in this case Page 67), it jumps you to the page in the document (in this case 68)
@Aayush is this something you can help with?
Hey @Tom Deaney if this is a bug, could you add this to the EPD board please.

When it goes to the right page, then I actually love this feature. I showed this to a life underwriter across a 243 page medical report and they were like “that ordinarily takes us a day….”. They basically do the same thing - go through the whole doc, take note of all references, then create an assessment.

It usually jumps to the right page -- sometimes for some document it jumps to the right page but slightly above so if you just scroll down a tiny bit you'll see the pgae count goes to the right page. don't know if this is the case here

Yes this should be a doc-widget bug. It does jump to the right page but the page number shows the wrong value - should be an alignment issue. @Serena this seems similar to the drifting issue we say earlier?
i really thought i solved all of these bugs in may :sobbadobbasob:  https://github.com/instabase/javascript-packages/pull/463
@Tom Deaney can you provide the document you’re using so that we can try to reproduce?
can you provide the prompt from your screenshot as well?

Extract the company name, scope 1 direct emissions, scope 2 location-based emissions, and unit of measurement for emissions for 2021. This report also includes 2022 UK, Overseas and Total data in the table, but ignore those figures and report 2021 total only. Return strictly as JSON with the headings: Company name, Scope 1 (direct emissions), Scope 2 (location-based), unit of emissions. This should report on actual performance, rather than specific to a particular line of business. Convert the output into mt (million metric tonnes), and output to 3 DP.
